description: This is a bushwack hike to a small but pretty waterfall on Barrys Brook in Aulds Cove.  this brook drains a few large lakes all of which have dams.  The dams do not have falls associated with them but I saw an interesting feature in google earth.  I followed the brook from the lake and dam and found a pretty little fall nestled in a mixed forest.
directions: In aulds Cove.  turn on highway 344 towards Mulgrave.  Park at the top of the hill, opposite the quarry at; 45°38'14.6"N 61°25'56.2"W.  there is an old woods road leading you towards the fall.  The falls are at; 45°38'4.61"N,  61°26'22.02"W  ...easiest to do with a gps.
title: Barrys Brook Fall
